title: Amulet of regeneration
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Jewellery                                                                                                  |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Amulet of regeneration                                                                                     |
| Icon | [![Amulet of regeneration.png](/images/1/18/Amulet_of_regeneration.png)](/File:Amulet_of_regeneration.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                                                         |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An amulet that increases the wearer's natural regeneration rate. In order to function, it must first attune itself to the wearer's body at full health. |

An **amulet of regeneration** increases its wearer's [regeneration rate](/Regeneration_rate "Regeneration rate") by +0.8 HP/turn, greatly hastening the HP recovery rate of your character. This benefit becomes less pronounced as your max HP rises, but its effect is always substantial.

Increased regeneration does not begin until after your HP has been at maximum while wearing the amulet, so there's no point in swapping one on after a battle to recover faster. -Regen from [Inhibited Regeneration](/Inhibited_Regeneration "Inhibited Regeneration") prevents this amulet from working.

## Desirability

An amulet of regeneration is welcome. For a good portion of the game, this amulet's regen is a noticeable help in combat. In addition, reducing your recovery time lowers your [piety](/Piety "Piety") decay, and makes it less likely for wandering enemies to find you while you rest. You may prefer an amulet that's more suited towards combat, such as an [amulet of reflection](/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") or [faith](/Amulet_of_faith "Amulet of faith"), but this isn't a bad choice.

Regeneration is welcome for players looking to [minimize turn count](/Speedrun "Speedrun"). If you're using magic, though, an [amulet of magic regeneration](/Amulet_of_magic_regeneration "Amulet of magic regeneration") is usually a better choice for this goal.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), the regeneration bonus was +1 HP/turn.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), the regeneration bonus was +0.4 HP/turn.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), the amulet of regeneration began working immediately, and also increased the wearer's metabolism.
- The amulet of regeneration was added in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), replacing the [ring of regeneration](/Ring_of_regeneration "Ring of regeneration").

| [Jewellery](/Jewellery "Jewellery") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| [Rings](/Ring "Ring")               | [Dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") • [Evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion") • [Fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire") • [Flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") • [Ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice") • [Intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence") • [Magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power") • [Poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") • [Positive energy](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy") • [Protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") • [Protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold") • [Protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire") • [Resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") • [See invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible") • [Slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying") • [Strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength") • [Willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower") • [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry") |
html:
Amulet of regeneration

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Jewellery
Name Amulet of regeneration
Icon
An amulet that increases the wearer's natural regeneration rate. In order to function, it must first attune itself to the wearer's body at full health.

An amulet of regeneration increases its wearer's regeneration rate by +0.8 HP/turn, greatly hastening the HP recovery rate of your character. This benefit becomes less pronounced as your max HP rises, but its effect is always substantial.

Increased regeneration does not begin until after your HP has been at maximum while wearing the amulet, so there's no point in swapping one on after a battle to recover faster. -Regen from Inhibited Regeneration prevents this amulet from working.

Desirability

An amulet of regeneration is welcome. For a good portion of the game, this amulet's regen is a noticeable help in combat. In addition, reducing your recovery time lowers your piety decay, and makes it less likely for wandering enemies to find you while you rest. You may prefer an amulet that's more suited towards combat, such as an amulet of reflection or faith, but this isn't a bad choice.

Regeneration is welcome for players looking to minimize turn count. If you're using magic, though, an amulet of magic regeneration is usually a better choice for this goal.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, the regeneration bonus was +1 HP/turn.
  • Prior to 0.27, the regeneration bonus was +0.4 HP/turn.
  • Prior to 0.18, the amulet of regeneration began working immediately, and also increased the wearer's metabolism.
  • The amulet of regeneration was added in 0.16, replacing the ring of regeneration.
Jewellery
Amulets Acrobat • Faith • Guardian spirit • Magic regeneration • Reflection • Regeneration
Rings Dexterity • Evasion • Fire • Flight • Ice • Intelligence • Magical power •
Poison resistance • Positive energy • Protection • Protection from cold • Protection from fire • Resist corrosion • See invisible • Slaying • Strength • Willpower • Wizardry
